thread.section_title: Heard on the Street - Wall Street Journal
thread.title: The New Winners and Losers in Investment Banking

author: Paul J. Davies
title: The New Winners and Losers in Investment Banking

organizations.name: new winners and losers in investment banking new

text:
New technology, more transparency and fresh regulations are deepening the divide between winners and losers among global investment banks. The winners are big or small, and generally American; the losers are European banks that are stuck in the middle.
Winning may only be relative for banks like Goldman Sachs because the biggest pressures are on trading with financial clients like asset managers and hedge funds. Losers like Deutsche Bank face the same problems, but are weighed down by a dreadful combination of higher costs,...
